title: Customized Instructional Design to Enhance Thinking Patterns and Motivation in Digital Video Production Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency (e.g., smartphone/computer utilization)
context.additional_context: A blended environment combining learner-paced and system-paced learning speed controls. Designed to account for varying motivation levels based on learnersâ€™ cognitive styles (legislative, executive, judicial).

learning_goals: Learners can diagnose their thinking styles (legislative/executive/judicial) and explain learning strategies tailored to their characteristics.
In a learner-led environment, learners with legislative thinking traits can create autonomy-based project plans.
In a system-led environment, learners with executive/judicial thinking traits can complete content following structured production guidelines.
All learners can analyze cases applying motivational elements (ARCS Model: Attention/Relevance/Confidence/Satisfaction) in the digital video production process.

resources: Digital Video Production Software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Rush)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
